description.narrative: 1.4 Increased capacity to legislate, plan and budget to improve health systems including mainstreaming DRR to plan for, respond to and mitigate the effects of disasters, which contributes to Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Early Childhood Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, including newborns and adolescents, and women of reproductive age have improved and equitable access to and use of high-impact quality health interventions and improved healthy behaviors.

description.narrative: UNICEF has handed over all 74 fully equipped prefabricated health facilities to government in earthquake affected areas as part of the earthquake recovery. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2019
